isis.stitle: CAB: 4100, 4200, 4300 AND 4400 MODELS - REMOVE - CAB DOOR WINDOW SLIDE BLOCK

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Door Window Slide Block on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models

note.para: It is not necessary to remove the front cab door glass to remove the front cab door window slide block.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 60
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If vehicle is equipped with electric door window, lower cab door glass (Item 4) to the bottom of front cab door (Item 3) before disconnecting electric window switch panel (Item 5) during front cab door trim panel (Item 1) removal.

Remove front cab door trim panel, refer to CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL . If front cab door is equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks. If front cab door is equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks.

Remove front cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to CAB DOOR INNER DOOR PANEL WATER SHIELD
. For removing front cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Inner Door Panel Water Shield on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 60
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If vehicle is equipped with manual door window, temporarily place the window regulator handle (Item 6) on the window regulator handle shaft (Item 7) and lower cab door glass (Item 4) to the bottom of front cab door (Item 3), driver side shown.

Working through the cab door access opening (Item 8), using a blunt tip flat blade screw driver (Item 9), carefully pry window regulator arm (Item 10) from the cab door window slide block (Item 11) in the cab door window slide rail (Item 12), driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 62 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Working through the cab door access opening, using a small flat blade screw driver (Item 1), carefully brake off the plastic retaining tab (Item 2) used to keep the cab door window slide block (Item 3) from sliding off the cab door window slide rail (Item 4), driver side shown.
Once the plastic retaining tab (Item 2) is removed , slide the cab door window slide block (Item 3) from the cab door window slide rail (Item 4), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 62. Front Cab Door Window Slide Block

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab door window slide block.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Rear Cab Door Window Slide Block on Crew Cab for all Models

note.para: It is not necessary to remove the rear cab door glass to remove the rear cab door window slide block.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 61
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If vehicle is equipped with electric door window, lower cab door glass (Item 4) to the bottom of rear cab door (Item 3) before disconnecting electric window switch panel (Item 5) during rear cab door trim panel (Item 1) removal.

Remove rear cab door trim panel, refer to CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL . If rear cab door is equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks. If rear cab door is equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks.

Remove rear cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to CAB DOOR INNER DOOR PANEL WATER SHIELD
. For removing rear cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Inner Door Panel Water Shield on Crew Cab for all Models.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 61
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If vehicle is equipped with manual door window, temporarily place the window regulator handle (Item 6) on the window regulator handle shaft (Item 7) and lower cab door glass (Item 4) to the bottom of rear cab door (Item 3), driver side shown.

Working through the cab door access opening (Item 8), using a blunt tip flat blade screw driver (Item 9), carefully pry window regulator arm (Item 10) from the cab door window slide block (Item 11) in the cab door window slide rail (Item 12), driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 63 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Working through the cab door access opening, using a small flat blade screw driver (Item 1), carefully brake off the plastic retaining tab (Item 2) used to keep the cab door window slide block (Item 3) from sliding off the cab door window slide rail (Item 4), driver side shown.
Once the plastic retaining tab (Item 2) is removed , slide the cab door window slide block (Item 3) from the cab door window slide rail (Item 4), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 63. Rear Cab Door Window Slide Block

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side rear cab door window slide block.
